Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: Father, how did you find me?

Speaker: kepheus
Dialogue: I thought this boy's father was a God. How does a stranger walk unmolested into the Throne Room of the King?

Speaker: amoun
Dialogue: I sent for him, Lord. This good man raised Perseus from infancy. He will help him now.

Speaker: kepheus
Dialogue: Help him with what?

Speaker: spyros
Dialogue: With whatever is needed... Perseus approaches the King. Surprising himself --

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: He will help me destroy Leviathan. Spyros does a double-take, then swallows: "Yeah, okay, sure."

Speaker: kepheus
Dialogue: But how? Perseus has no idea.

Speaker: amoun
Dialogue: Majesty, we can seek the counsel of the Norn Sisters of Skolothia. They know the hidden ways of the Gods. If Leviathan can be slain, they'll know how to do it.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: We have thirty days to find its weakness.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: We'll leave tonight.

Speaker: kepheus
Dialogue: With what army? I dare not weaken our forces when the city is about to be besieged.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: (uncertain, glances

Speaker: amoun
Dialogue: My King, with your permission... The King assents, seemingly lost. Amoun speaks to Perseus.

Speaker: amoun
Dialogue: I'll give you a map and much more. I'll go with you and bring a small band of comrades to help you on your mission. We can leave at first light.  Diokles, the map. The men move to the work area, where the Aide selects a map from dozens. Something catches Perseus' eye.

Speaker: perseus' pov
Dialogue: Andromeda, up in the balcony, has made herself visible only to him. She silently mouths these words -- "Thank... you."

Speaker: amoun
Dialogue: We head north on the Via Dahlia. If we can make it to the Disputed Territories... MOVE IN ON the tip of Amoun's pointer on the

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: Amoun, it seems an odd coincidence you came into my life as tutor, so long ago, and now, once again you instruct me.

Speaker: spyros
Dialogue: Who would have thought we'd be on a journey like this? Two simple fishermen.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: I'm afraid I've dragged you into real danger, Father, when I have little idea of what I'm doing.

Speaker: spyros
Dialogue: Living at the mercy of the sea so long has convinced me some adventures are unexpected and some dangers unavoidable. It's all in your attitude.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: What's our attitude about destroying Leviathan?

Speaker: spyros
Dialogue: The Kraken is just another big fish. Perseus smiles, but is not as sanguine.

Speaker: tiamat
Dialogue: Yes. I beseech you, track the expedition.

Speaker: set
Dialogue: To plainly thwart them would betray our intentions and draw the wrath of Zeus and the others.

Speaker: tiamat
Dialogue: That, we cannot have. I merely suggest that the road to Skolothia is hazardous.

Speaker: set
Dialogue: I take your meaning. And your loyal brute, he is fixed upon the hunt?

Speaker: peshet
Dialogue: You must sleep.  Princessat You must take care of yourself. A CRACK OF THUNDER. Andromeda looks over at her, thinking.

Speaker: andromeda
Dialogue: My father was ready to sacrifice me to the monster.

Speaker: peshet
Dialogue: I'm sure that is not so.

Speaker: andromeda
Dialogue: I saw it. I heard the words. My loving father, his beloved child. Only Perseus stayed his decision.

Speaker: andromeda
Dialogue: The city is besieged, the people suffer.

Speaker: peshet
Dialogue: Go to sleep, my lady.

Speaker: andromeda
Dialogue: Sleep? Sleep will come soon enough for me, faithful one. In one month... at the latest. The palace shakes with the ROLLING THUNDER.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: Joppa is pummelled by the Dark Goddess.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: By what name may mortals call you?

Speaker: wilting girl
Dialogue: I have no name.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: Who do your worshippers pray to?

Speaker: wilting girl
Dialogue: I can't remember.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: Perhaps that is why they are falling in number?

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: I have to call you something...

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: That's a pretty name. Wait, better yet -- 'Vidalia'? How's that... 'Vidalia'? That's more than pretty, beautiful really, just as you are. She is pleased, self-conscious, concentrating on the road ahead.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: You don't like it?  What's that? I missed it --

Speaker: wilting girl
Dialogue: (just loud enough to

Speaker: draco
Dialogue: More. The Mongols stare -- either not comprehending or ready to fight.

Speaker: draco
Dialogue: It must last all night. Get some more.

Speaker: abas
Dialogue: Commander, I'll get some, too. Perseus and Abas head off into the woods in different directions.

Speaker: his pov
Dialogue: The leaves offer tantalizing cover to her naked body. She dives in with a quiet SPLASH.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: Now is when an honorable man would turn around and walk away...

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: Vidalia...

Speaker: set
Dialogue: Hear me, my pet. Let my instructions be seared to your primal mind as natural law.

Speaker: set
Dialogue: You are starving. Your gut says you'll soon perish. No earthly meat will still that hunger. What you need, what you ache for, is the flesh of... a demigod!

Speaker: draco
Dialogue: Pegassi, stallions of the Gods.

Speaker: icos
Dialogue: Perseus. How long do you think you could stay on one of those? Icos and Boreas exchange a sly look.

Speaker: boreas
Dialogue: Don't goad the boy, Icos. No Man can ride a Pegasus.

Speaker: icos
Dialogue: Did not Bellerophon tame the Great White Pegasus?

Speaker: boreas
Dialogue: You're right. But he was a demigod...

Speaker: draco
Dialogue: Stop it, rogues. One of our own has disappeared without a trace and all you can think is to cause mischief. What if Perseus is bucked to his death from a thousand feet up?

Speaker: draco
Dialogue: Don't do this. If we go back to camp right now, we can avoid trouble and keep our goal in sight. A true leader will not be distracted.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: I'm not the leader, Draco, Amoun is. I'm too young to start avoiding trouble. Perseus jumps up and approaches a roan Pegasus, speaking soothingly. It WHINNIES and threshes its wings, buffeting Perseus with gusts. The Pegasus rears up, and leaps over Perseus' head. It lands behind him, bucks its hind legs, and kicks Perseus face-first into the dirt. Icos and Boreas are laughing, but when Draco gives them a dark look, Boreas jumps up, sobered, and heads into the clearing.

Speaker: boreas
Dialogue: I'll collect him right now, Commander. Suddenly, Humbaba erupts from the thicket with a HOWL. The Pegassi take flight, but the Humbaba grabs one and swallows it whole. Humbaba turns and SNIFFS the air, homing in on Perseus.

Speaker: draco
Dialogue: Perseus, get out of there! Icos, fetch the others. Icos bolts. Draco and Boreas leap into the clearing with swords drawn to draw the monster's attention. Perseus does the same.

Speaker: draco
Dialogue: I told you to run, boy. You'll make things worse.

Speaker: icos
Dialogue: A Humbaba! Mongke and Tamburlane fly into the woods; the others follow.

Speaker: draco
Dialogue: Boreas! Draco hacks at the monster's leg, to no avail. it rips off Boreas' head and swallows his body. Perseus CRIES OUT and leaps at the creature, sword swinging.

Speaker: vidalia
Dialogue: A delusion is planted in its mind. It thinks it's starving and it wants to feed on --

Speaker: vidalia
Dialogue: I can't reverse the powerful curse. But if the monster's hungry, I can feed it. Vidalia raises her arms and shuts her eyes. A cyclone of CAWING RAVENS descends from the sky and dives straight into the monster's mouth. As the Humbaba tries to shake them away, Mongke is thrown clear.

Speaker: vidalia
Dialogue: I should cast a spell upon you and leave you forever a stone upon this stream.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: I didn't beckon the Humbaba.

Speaker: vidalia
Dialogue: You did, with your childish recklessness, and Boreas has paid the price! Perseus, already rife with guilt, is stung by the truth.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: The monster killed my friend. I could not contain my rage. But you, Goddess, are aloof from the emotions of Men. Vidalia's eyes narrow, enraged.

Speaker: vidalia
Dialogue: Yes, a tyrannical Goddess, who dares question your mad rush to annihilation.

Speaker: peshet
Dialogue: Where have you brought me?

Speaker: agenor
Dialogue: Just listen to this good man. He needs your help. Fantasos comes forward. He fixes her with a hypnotic gaze.

Speaker: fantasos
Dialogue: Do you know who I am, child?

Speaker: peshet
Dialogue: You are the Priest of the Streets.

Speaker: fantasos
Dialogue: That's right. You know that the good common people of Joppa trust that I will look after their welfare.

Speaker: peshet
Dialogue: Some do...

Speaker: fantasos
Dialogue: Do you love the people of Joppa, Peshet? (as she nods,

Speaker: peshet
Dialogue: I have always served the royal family.

Speaker: fantasos
Dialogue: Yes, you have, good Peshet. And now you may be in a better position than anyone to help the Princessa save the city.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: Master Amoun... You knew about me, didn't you? When you came to our village?

Speaker: amoun
Dialogue: Your birth was written in the stars. I sought you out and took it as my cause to teach you.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: You chose a poor student. I have learned little and my mistakes cost dearly.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: I do not believe my fate is to be half a God. No demigod could feel as confused as I do tonight.

Speaker: amoun
Dialogue: Concentrate on the task before you. All answers will come with that.

Speaker: lookout
Dialogue: The Night Patrol returns on the Gorge Road! That message is shouted along from Sentries to Guards in the camp. OUT IN THE DARKNESS on the dusty Gorge Road, a dozen Soldiers gallop in GROUND-SHAKING FORMATION toward the firelit encampment.

Speaker: tiamat
Dialogue: My loyal friend. it is beneath you to stalk this band of infidels one by one. Events demand more decisive action. Kalibos' SPEECH is as tortured and deformed as his body --

Speaker: kalibos
Dialogue: Grorashnrd... I to be... ruler... rhodirs... made whole... sovfrenty... kingdom mine...

Speaker: tiamat
Dialogue: Yes, Kalibos, the time is nigh when I restore you to your rightful form -- proud Acrisius. With me, your protector, on the throne of Olympos... the violator Zeus deposed. Kalibos reacts, with what must be satisfaction.

Speaker: fantasos
Dialogue: How much are we meant to suffer? Where is your mighty King? Safely cloistered above the flood... on the high ground, with the high- born -- the privileged gentry!... The angry crowd responds, fists shaking. Peshet moves through the throng, desperately looking for Andromeda. She passes close to the rostrum and Fantasos registers her presence.

Speaker: fantasos
Dialogue: . Does Kepheus worry about you? No! Only the Princessa... And still, the Kraken comes! Does the King build his defenses at the water's edge? "NO!" cries the crowd. Peshet is shocked to find herself replying with them -- "NO1" Fantasos motions for Agenor to continue the harangue, while Fantasos hurries off the stage.

Speaker: agenor
Dialogue: No! He makes his stand at his daughter's chamber door!... We will show Kepheus we're not sacrificial fodder. We will tremble the walls of his Basilica! RABID SUPPORT from the mob. Peshet stops suddenly, peering ahead.

Speaker: fantasos
Dialogue: One night soon, a gong will sound three times. When you hear it, unlock the back gate of the Basilica. Then go to Andromeda's chambers...  . and bring the Princess out. My men will take her to Leviathan. Peshet just stares at the dagger, hands trembling.

Speaker: fantasos
Dialogue: Do you understand me? (harshly, off her non-

Speaker: amoun
Dialogue: You wanted to know about Djinn Raiders. Here they are.

Speaker: draco
Dialogue: Look sharp. Watch your surround.

Speaker: vidalia
Dialogue: The Alkali Lotus... She stops, spotting something in the distance. Kosmo pulls up.

Speaker: vidalia
Dialogue: What is that?

Speaker: their pov
Dialogue: shimmering through the desert heat -- tents and flags.

Speaker: draco
Dialogue: Where is everyone? Spyros HEARS something and follows the SOUND to a tent, weapon ready.

Speaker: spyros
Dialogue: Draco, tell me what this -- Everyone is standing perfectly still. DARK FIGURES surround them. The transformed Cleon Legion lurches INTO VIEW. The only resemblance to the soldiers they were is their armor.. Now they're monstrous creatures: LOTOPHAGI.

Speaker: amoun
Dialogue: Muster to me!

Speaker: amoun
Dialogue: Come on! You can pass through! Draco bolts for the barrier. A Lotophagi spears Kosmo, killing him. Draco slides inside the swarm. He looks back at Kosmo in horror. Polluc slashes zombies and runs toward the swarm. He's almost there when one of the Lotophagi lands on him, sinking fangs into his skull. Polluc sticks his sword into the creature; they both fall over dead. Icos and Spyros fight their way to the swarm and jump inside. Mongke and Tamburlane kill a Lotus-eater and leap over the corpse into the protected circle. The tide of HOWLING and SHRIEKING Lotophagi claw at the barrier of insects to no avail.

Speaker: amoun
Dialogue: Only humans can penetrate the shield! Perseus takes quick stock of the group inside the swarm, thinking.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: Only humans... He looks over the Lotophagi and sees Vidalia out there, alone, flinging sling-bullets as she fights her way toward the barrier.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: Drop the barrier!                                          r

Speaker: amoun
Dialogue: No! It's too late for her!

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: Drop it, Amoun! At that moment, Kalibos grabs Vidalia and drags her to the top of an outcrop. At the top, he turns, LOOKS DIRECTLY AT PERSEUS and HOWLS, his message clear: "If you want to save her, come and get her." He hungrily rips her leather bandeau. Perseus turns to Amoun.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: Take the barrier down or I'll go through it!

Speaker: amoun
Dialogue: Have you learned nothing? If you break out now, we're all at risk. On the boulder, Kalibos grabs Vidalia's white flesh. Perseus is anguished; he knows he's in love.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: Get down! Perseus backs away three steps. To the others               --

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: Get ready to defend yourselves! Perseus runs, plants a foot on Thad's back and leaps out through the swarm, which immediately dissipates around the humans. They have only a moment to react as the stunned Lotophagi come to their senses.

Speaker: draco
Dialogue: Let's kill these freks! Perseus runs over the backs of the Lotophagi. Hurtling off them, he scrambles up and knocks Kalibos off Vidalia. Ralibos rolls, flips onto his feet and gives Perseus a look: "You're the one that I want." They face off, looking for an opening. Perseus lunges, thrusting his sword. Kalibos dodges, springing up the rocks and then down toward Perseus, acrobatic as an ape. Perseus rolls out of the way. Perseus sweeps his sword at Kalibos' head. The monster catches the blade in his jaws and SNAPS IT IN TWO! Bloody spittle flies from his tongue. Kalibos pounces, pins Perseus. He opens his jaw and sinks his teeth into Perseus' shoulder. Vidalia cracks a rock into Kalibos' head. The creature whirls on Vidalia and careens toward her, head bloody. Perseus leaps in the air and catches Kalibos in the back with both feet, knocking him over the edge.

Speaker: down below
Dialogue: Draco, Spyros, Amoun and the others hack away, fending off the Lotophagi. Outnumbered, they won't last long. The earth VIBRATES. The Lotophagi are distracted, looking around nervously. Over a rise stampede SCORPIOCHS, rhino-sized scorpions. Riding them, DJINN RAIDERS, flowing black silk masking all but their blue eyes. They lay into the Lotophagi. The Scorpiochs skewer the beasts with HUGE PINCERS. The Djinn use flashing SCIMITARS to cut them down.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: Vidalia... we need to help them... He blacks out. Vidalia cranes to look over the edge of the cliff where Kalibos fell. She is mystified by what

Speaker: vidalia
Dialogue: To save me, you risked everything -- your mission, your friends... the fate of multitudes. Men need better judgment in the one who is meant to lead them... No longer able to lecture, she regards him with love.

Speaker: vidalia
Dialogue: You shouldn't have risked your life for me. It is a waste to save me when I'll be gone so soon. She strokes his hair and kisses his forehead.

Speaker: vidalia
Dialogue: Thank you for your reckless disregard. Thank you, Perseus... Vidalia holds her palm above the floor and mutters a quick incantation. A small shoot APPEARS and SPROUTS FAT PODS. Vidalia squeezes the salve from a pod and covers Perseus' wound. The wound bulges, then squirms deeper into Perseus. Perseus shoots up, clutching his chest. Vidalia gently lays him down. Perseus gags. A VIPER WRIGGLES from his throat and slithers away with the fat lump of infection in its stomach.

Speaker: vidalia
Dialogue: The poison is gone now.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: Where... Where are we? The

Speaker: vidalia
Dialogue: In the Djinn caravan. They're escorting us to the Skolothian border.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: But I thought the Djinn...

Speaker: draco
Dialogue: The Skolothians have suffered more than their share in this war. The Legions of the Gods have battered them.

Speaker: spyros
Dialogue: It's no wonder they shy away from all strangers. Perseus looks ahead, where the Expedition is parting company with the Djinn Raiders. only one of the Djinn is staying -- SHAIKH SULEIMAN, a veiled priest.

Speaker: amoun
Dialogue: Because of you. You're the reason they saved us.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: Me? I don't understand.

Speaker: amoun
Dialogue: Why don't you ask him?

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: I thought they didn't speak.

Speaker: amoun
Dialogue: They have no mouths. That doesn't mean they do not speak.

Speaker: amoun
Dialogue: The Pillar of Moirai. Lair of the Norn Sisters.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: Tell me of them.

Speaker: amoun
Dialogue: They're witches in the form of Strix. Not a pleasant sight, a Strix. They have powerful magic and dreadful habits. Baby-eaters, among other things.  But they owe me a favor. When the war broke out, they lent their power to men against the Gods in exchange for infant sacrifice. Tiamat struck them blind for their treachery. When they came for help, I fashioned them an artificial eye, for their Second Sight.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: You made only one eye?

Speaker: amoun
Dialogue: (pleased with his

Speaker: spyros
Dialogue: Stay away from my boy! Without touching him, the Shaikh throws the fisherman over his head, where he lands hard with an "UMPH!" Perseus jolts awake. He reaches for his sword, but has none. Spyros struggles to his feet to start another charge. Suleiman raises his hand and freezes Spyros in his position. The Shaikh's veil has fallen, revealing his frightening countenance: scaled skin of charred wood; eyes like slots in a furnace. Perseus listens to the

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: Spyros, he means me no harm. The Shaikh lowers his hand: Spyros falls into the dirt. The Shaikh pulls his veil over his face. He kneels before Perseus, head bowed.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: I hear you and I understand you. But I don't know how.

Speaker: shaikh suleiman
Dialogue: Moi ne epos ae'prositi, mene daeva.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: You are praying to me? There must be a mistake. The Shaikh proffers the gleaming bronze sickle which has a zig-zag, LIGHTNING BOLT PATTERN engraved on the blade, honoring Zeus.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: An offering'? I thank you and take it humbly, as agift from a friend, not an offering. He takes the weapon and bows his head, surprising the Shaikh.

Speaker: shaikh suleiman
Dialogue: Tuj patir esti ho theos kosmosr.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: You honor my father? You honor Spyros?

Speaker: shaikh suleiman
Dialogue: Ho Zeus Patir... Zeus... Perseus reacts, taken aback to hear it from this mysterious stranger.

Speaker: urd
Dialogue: Amoun... So sorry to see you again.

Speaker: amoun
Dialogue: Likewise, Urd. I seek your counsel.

Speaker: amoun
Dialogue: You know already... of course.

Speaker: verdandi
Dialogue: We know this -- the Kraken cannot be defeated.

Speaker: amoun
Dialogue: Surely the beast from the sea has some weakness. You owe me this answer at least.

Speaker: urd
Dialogue: The Sisters owe nothing to you or any Man! She tosses the Eye to Verdandi, who focuses her attention on Perseus.

Speaker: verdandi
Dialogue: There's something wrong with that one. I don't like having him here.

Speaker: skuld
Dialogue: Let me take a look. Verdandi tosses the Eye to Skuld. Perseus leaps and snags the Eye out of mid-air. The Strix SCREECH. Perseus goes to the precipice.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: Tell us what we want to know or your Eye has seen its last.

Speaker: verdandi
Dialogue: You've brought a thief into our nest!

Speaker: urd
Dialogue: A villain!

Speaker: skuld
Dialogue: Scum!

Speaker: amoun
Dialogue: No, good Sisters... the son of Zeus. The Strix react in horror and all land on the same monolith.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: Since you cannot see, let me tell you what's about to happen. I'm about to throw this evil Eye to the rocks far below. I fear its journey will be a taxing one. The members of the Expedition are impressed; Vidalia, too: the young demigod shows growing leadership. The Strix are panicked --

Speaker: urd
Dialogue: We can't tell you. We don't dare betray Tiamat again.

Speaker: verdandi
Dialogue: She sees all! Her touch is felt in every evil thing!

Speaker: skuld
Dialogue: A second offense and she will

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: You don't have to tell us the secret. But you will have to live as blind as she made you.

Speaker: skuld
Dialogue: No! Give us the Eye and we'll tell.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: Tell me first. If I like the answer, you get your Eye.

Speaker: verdandi
Dialogue: We need the Eye to see the answer!

Speaker: amoun
Dialogue: You know the answer sure as you already knew the question. The Norn Sisters confer, enclosed in a curtain of wings.

Speaker: skuld
Dialogue: Leviathan can be destroyed...

Speaker: verdandi
Dialogue: The beast has one weakness.

Speaker: spyros
Dialogue: Tell us now! The Strix are torn, frightened. Finally --

Speaker: urd
Dialogue: The stare of Medusa. No creature can look directly in her eyes and still survive. The answer hangs in the silence of the stunned Expedition.

Speaker: amoun
Dialogue: They're lying, Perseus. Perseus studies the Sisters, weighing his response.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: I believe them.  Here's your second sight. Verdandi launches and catches it in her beak, pops it in her socket.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: And Medusa! Where does she abide?

Speaker: skuld
Dialogue: In Tartaros, beyond the frozen Tethys Sea. Only Charon's ferry dare challenge the ice.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: How can she be slain?

Speaker: verdandi
Dialogue: With extraordinary cunning and unimaginable luck. Skuld flaps to the pitch-black portal to an UNDERGROUND

Speaker: skuld
Dialogue: And the proper tools. Explore our cache of spoils. You may find such a tool. Perseus stares into the black entrance.

Speaker: draco
Dialogue: Don't go in there, Perseus. It's a trap.

Speaker: verdandi
Dialogue: No. We have guaranteed the rage of Tiamat with this revelation...

Speaker: skuld
Dialogue: . we ask only that the young God mention our aid...

Speaker: urd
Dialogue: ... to his Father.

Speaker: first mate
Dialogue: Captain, the storm is too great!

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: Joppa is under siege! King Kepheus needs these supplies! Something huge breaches the surface. The captain squints through the rain... and sees the GIGANTIC SCUTED TAIL of Leviathan. IT GOES RIGHT PAST THEM, miraculously leaving the fleet untouched. But then -- they HEAR a sound BIGGER than the typhoon. The dark sky gets darker as an ENORMOUS BLACK SHAPE appears behind the Fleet, bearing down on them at impossible speed -- TIAMAT'S PALACE-GALLEON so dwarfs the Fleet that it PLOWS THROUGH the other ships without noticing, obliterating them in seconds, sending all hands to the depths.

Speaker: thad
Dialogue: With respect, Magi, do not recite that black tale. You'll bring the sky down upon us.

Speaker: draco
Dialogue: Tell the story, sir. My men fear only one thing -- to let fear in their hearts. Mongke says something that means, "Go ahead already."

Speaker: amoun
Dialogue: Medusa was a tender young woman once -- a mortal creature of such rare beauty as to tempt even the Gods. One night, on the road home, she caught the eye of the God of Deserts and Entropy -- Set the Void.

Speaker: amoun
Dialogue: Charon's ferry.

Speaker: charon
Dialogue: Better stoke those fires, boys, it's going to get cold soon.

Speaker: vidalia
Dialogue: She's got a tail and she'll use it just like that. Perseus opens his eyes.

Speaker: vidalia
Dialogue: Keep your eyes shut! Open them with Medusa and it will be your last look.

Speaker: vidalia
Dialogue: Good! Pleased, he doesn't sense her right cross, which knocks him down.

Speaker: vidalia
Dialogue: Do you think the Gorgon will hit once and then surrender her head? He gets up, eyes closed, and resumes the defensive position, turning as she moves around him.

Speaker: vidalia
Dialogue: Listen... you will hear her muscles coil. Feel her hunger in your gut. Ask, how will she feed it?

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: I wish it, but I can't perceive the world that way.

Speaker: vidalia
Dialogue: You can. You're the son of a God.

Speaker: vidalia
Dialogue: We think a room is silent until someone points out the wind. Then the wind is all we hear. She strikes. He dodges and locks her neck. Pleased, she flips him.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: I'm beginning to hear the wind. (senses something,

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: Wait... She is already climbing the ladder. She stops for only a

Speaker: vidalia
Dialogue: You've learned enough for now.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: spyros
Dialogue: Nothing.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: What do you see?

Speaker: spyros
Dialogue: A look I know well.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: From me?

Speaker: spyros
Dialogue: Never before.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: Then where? Spyros smiles, puts his huge, calloused hand on Perseus' shoulder.

Speaker: spyros
Dialogue: In my own mirror, son.

Speaker: perseus
Dialogue: When does it go away?

Speaker: spyros
Dialogue: If we're lucky... never.

Speaker: shaikh suleiman
Dialogue: Jaggous temploi Tartaros de Gorgoneion maitress.
